summary: This bill, the Captain Paul W. Bud Bucha VA Medical Center Act of 2025, proposes to rename the Department of Veterans Affairs medical center in West Haven, Connecticut, in honor of Captain Paul W. Bud Bucha, a Medal of Honor recipient and advocate for veterans. The bill highlights Bucha's military service, his heroism in the Vietnam War, and his dedication to veterans' mental health. It also notes his use of the VA medical center in West Haven and his death from Alzheimer's. The bill aims to recognize his legacy and the care provided at the medical center.
